establishement_address: 1432 Rue Mackay, Montréal, QC H3G 2H7, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: The granddaddy of third-wave coffee in Montreal and founder of Café Myriade, Anthony Benda has completely reinvented craft coffee in the city. There are now three locations to choose from, but we prefer the original cramped little coffee front on Rue Mackay.
influencer2_quote_text: he OG Myriade is perfectly situated for you to grab a brew from 49th Parallel Roasters and guest roasters and a yummy snack before you hit the books.

establishement_address: 1351 Rachel St E, Montreal, Québec H2J 2K2, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: This "Comptoir à Cocktails" gets the nod for astute takes on classic cocktails, tiki drinks and seminars on topics like bitters, grogs, and molecular mixology. Over seven years in the game now, impressively.
influencer2_quote_text: Lab is a dimly lighted speakeasy of brick and dark wood where the mad mixologist Fabien Maillard and fellow “labtenders” ceaselessly research new cures for your sobriety.

establishement_address:
536 Avenue Duluth E, Montréal, QC H2L 1A9, Canada
11382, rang de la Fresnière, St Benoit de Mirabel, QC J7N 2R9, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: Martin Picard’s cholesterol-fueled emporium continues to churn out its famous foie gras poutine and duck-in-a-can. From May to October, you can also find Picard’s delicacies in a food truck on the streets of Montréal.
influencer2_quote_text: You need to show up hungry to the point of predatory. The city's dining scene thrives on fortifying food, but Au Pied de Cochon is the most unremitting-fantastically so.

establishement_address: 5322 Boul St-Laurent, Montréal, QC H2T 1A5, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: Its fresh, delicious, and classic dishes helped propel it to the forefront of Montreal’s brunch scene (breakfast banh-mi, holla at me); but if you also happen to enjoy amazing mimosas, then you’re going find another reason to fall in love with Sparrow all over again
influencer2_quote_text: https://www.thrillist.com/travel/montreal/the-8-coolest-bars-in-montreal

establishement_address: 417 Rue St. Pierre, Montréal, QC H2Y 2M4, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: Flyjin is a Japanese restaurant different from anything you’ve ever experienced. Amazing dishes with incredible presentation, a stunning array of cocktails, and a swanky, unique supper club vibe.
influencer2_quote_text: The synchronized lighting system sets the mood to a darker tone making the atmosphere smooth and relaxing. Join the movement under the exclusive underground Izakaya.

establishement_address: 5135 Boul St-Laurent, Montréal, QC H2T 1R9, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: Their style aims more towards the younger folk, but a lot of the pieces are so flattering and simple, you could be good to wear them for a long time to come.
influencer2_quote_text: Unicorn is a veritable hunting ground for local fashionistas seeking out the latest trends. It stocks a handpicked selection of local designers as well as international labels for both men and women.

establishement_address: 5330 Boul St-Laurent, Montréal, QC H2T 1S1, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: One man’s trash is another man’s livelihood in Mile End, a bohemian neighborhood whose vintage-store-per-capita ratio must be among the highest in North America. Want to get gussied up like a stylish grandparent?
influencer2_quote_text: Its owners Rebecca and Lara, select each piece focusing on quality and current trends. Their pieces end up reflecting classic, timeless styles for both men and women, that slip seamlessly into a modern wardrobe!

establishement_address: 2047 Avenue du Mont-Royal E, Montréal, QC H2H 1J7, Canada
influencer1_article_url: Where else can you order booze by the liter and have it served to you in a mason jar? Also, you get jars of goldfish crackers to snack on while you drink.
influencer1_quote_text: https://www.thrillist.com/travel/montreal/the-8-coolest-bars-in-montreal
influencer2_quote_text: http://www.mtlblog.com/2014/04/10-montreal-bars-you-should-go-to-more-than-once-in-your-life/11/

establishement_address: 4777 Avenue Pierre-de Coubertin
influencer1_quote_text: Eternal summer awaits inside the humid tropical forest of the Biodôme, a glass-roofed nature preserve containing multiple ecosystems. You might glimpse iguanas, frogs, bats, snakes, sloths and other exotic creatures as you wend your way among the dense vegetation, streams and stone caverns.
influencer2_quote_text: Montreal’s Biodôme Is A Tropical Paradise To Escape To In The City, Like a far away vacation close to home.

establishement_address: 281 Rue Bernard O, Montréal, QC H2V 1T5, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: "I didn't want to be a burger restaurant. I didn't put a burger on the menu until two or three months in." It was a momentous decision. Seaton's menu is chock-full of crowd-pleasers — matzo ball soup, crab cakes, wedge salad, mac and cheese, grilled hanger steak — but her burger accounts for a big chunk of the restaurant's business.
influencer2_quote_text: With a super solid selection of awesome, tasty, and original brunch options – such as their famous lumberjack sandwich – Nouveau Palais is definitely going to be one of your new favourite brunch spots in the city. Of course, they also score huge bonus points due to the fact that they serve up some seriously legit mimosas for under $7.

establishement_address: 3709 Boul St-Laurent, Montréal, QC H2X 2V7, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: Most people go to the Tokyo Bar for the great dancing compliments of top DJs as it's a dance club without the dance club attitude - just high energy dancing.
influencer2_quote_text: The Concordia University urban dictionary calls a crazy grinding dance floor “Tokyo Thursday,” after the famous nightclub’s well-known party night, now going into its seventh year.

establishement_address: 19 Rue Prince Arthur O, Montréal, QC H2X 1S4, Canada
influencer1_name: Ian Harrison and Rose Maura Lorre
influencer1_quote_text: This self-described espresso bar artisanal gave the previously café-bereft Milton-Parc neighbourhood a lift when it opened in 2013.
influencer2_quote_text: A quaint little coffee shop with a selection of pastries, freshly squeezed juice, and caffeinated brews – what more could you ask for from your neighborhood craft coffee shop?

establishement_address: 904 Rue Sherbrooke O, Montréal, QC H3A 3R8, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: When rustic chic meets third wave coffee shop! This eclectic shop, a tranquil and welcoming retreat from the bustle of downtown, only serves the finest products, like Intelligentsia Coffee and Mast Brothers chocolates.
influencer2_quote_text: a superb little place for your morning and afternoon jolt. Located in the heart of downtown Montreal, the smell of ground coffee beans and freshly baked goods attracts a constant flow of coffee-lovers all day long.

establishement_address: 5605 Avenue de Gaspé, Montréal, QC H2T 2M1, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: There is a mix of Tokyo, Paris, and Montreal in Café Falco, a little gem hided in an otherwise generic warehouse building on a side street near the east end of Saint-Viateur. Yuko Toda, who owns the place with her husband Frederick, serves cuisine of her native Japan, and has taken inspiration for the decoration from her years of graphic design studies in Paris.
influencer2_quote_text: This Mile End spot is a beautifully designed space that evokes serenity and gives you the push you need to engage in productive bursts of creative work. The latte here is unlike anything you’ve ever experienced, and the Japanese siphon-made coffee is a work of art.

establishement_address: 1380 Rue Sherbrooke O
influencer1_quote_text: On the final Sunday of each month, the museum open up the Collections and Discovery Exhibitions to the entire public for free (people aged 12 to 30 can get in for free all month long).
influencer2_quote_text: stroll down a street of ancient Pompeii past the enchanted garden, the impluvium, through the leisure spaces, even the bedroom and baths of the typical 79 A.D. home — days before Mount Vesuvius erupted.

establishement_address: 2015, boulevard St.Laurent
establishement_hours: Monday to Saturday: 10 a.m. to 10 p.m., Sunday 12 p.m. to 8 p.m.
influencer1_quote_text: I’ve spent entire afternoons in this veritable vintage maze rummaging through stacks of bowling shoes, old television sets, stuffed animals, etc. With a towering ‘Everything for $1’ pit, trust me, you’ll be hard-pressed to leave empty handed.
influencer2_quote_text: For a scavenger-hunt-like shopping experience, head to boutique Eva B. This crafty little shop includes a 1$ thrift pile, as well as a few designer finds.

establishement_address: 1832 Rue William, Montréal, QC H3J 1R5, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: With dishes like a peanut butter and jelly sandwich assembled on brioche bread and layered with foie gras (a.k.a. the PBJFG), seared beef tartare mixed with potatoes, raw quail’s egg and grapefruit oil, and lasagna made with slices of marinated celery root that are blowtorched right before serving, this kitchen is taking all kinds of risks. And succeeding!
influencer2_quote_text: The chef, whose pedigree includes stints at Corton in New York and Geist in Copenhagen, is making some of the city’s most interesting food in the forms of tempura garlic scapes and blowtorched celery root lasagna layered with Parmesan cream.

establishement_address: 4764 Avenue Papineau, Montréal, QC H2L 2R5, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: What that roving kitchen did, this new sit-down spot does even more so. I’ll admit that I walked in wanting to love it, but I didn’t leave disappointed. There’s a touch of grand-mère about the place that gets you in a warm embrace.
influencer2_quote_text: How can you resist such an exaltation? Don't, it would be a shame, because everything is as described. Every plate and dish is delicious, balanced, and enthuastically enjoyable. You need a special kind of talent to be able to generate enthusiasm for brussel sprouts.

establishement_address: 1253 Avenue McGill College, Montréal, QC H3B, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: For a coffee shop buried deep down Montréal’s vast underground network, Tunnel espresso has made quite a reputation for itself despite its unconventional location. This hole‑in‑the‑wall shop serves independently brewed coffee and some of the best macadamia nut cookies in the city.
influencer2_quote_text: The minimally styled coffee bar, with two locations in Montreal’s downtown core, is part of the city’s expanding third wave coffee movement. As such, owner and coffee aficionado Andy Kyres has infused a keen business sense with a generous shot of social responsibility. “My whole ethos is I deal locally; I deal with artisans because I know what I’m getting. I support independent communities in any sense,” he said.

establishement_address: 6631 Boul St-Laurent, Montréal, QC H2S 3C5, Canada
influencer1_article_url: Do J.P. and Marie-Claude even have your new cell number? What to do? Go back to the racines of it all and do a Wednesday night at Vices et Versa, where traditional Quebec music and traditional Quebec beer are the order of the day.
influencer1_quote_text: http://ca.askmen.com/montreal/vices-et-versa.html
influencer2_article_url: It's a low-key, local joint with occasional musical acts and a lovely backyard beer garden.
influencer2_quote_text: http://www.frommers.com/destinations/montreal/nightlife/869232

establishement_address: 1254 Rue Mackay
influencer1_name: Leslie Brokaw, Erin Trahan, Matthew Barber
influencer1_quote_text: The Upstairs Jazz Bar, actually down a few steps from the street, has been hosting live jazz music nightly since 1995. Big names are infrequent, but the groups are more than competent.
influencer2_quote_text: “The nice thing about our story is that we keep writing different chapters,” he says. “After 20 years, I still love everything about it — booking the groups, running the business, pricing the menu, doing the sound checks. I love greeting the customers and hearing how much they enjoy the music.”

establishement_address: 244 Rue de Castelnau Est, Montréal, QC H2R 1P5, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: Larue & Fils now has two idyllic, luminous locations and proudly serves Montréal-brewed coffee. They also have a vintage blue Citroën truck roaming the streets of Montréal in the summertime.
influencer2_quote_text: Le café Larue utilise du café torréfié ici même à Montréal. Ce dernier est torréfié de façon sicilienne. « Larue n’est pas un café de la troisième vague, on est plus traditionnel. On fait du très bon café et on traite le produit avec respect », souligne Guillaume Adan. Côté bouffe, Larue propose plusieurs sandwichs et quelques viennoiseries.

establishement_address: 3500 Boul St-Laurent, Montréal, QC H2X 2V2, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: Ecole Privee is also best known for its exotic room filled with naked pictures of women where now you can reserve your own exclusive table. Montreal’s newest underground club has a lot to offer, so make your way to Ecole Privee to experience something fresh and wild.
influencer2_quote_text: he venue has the best sound system currently available in the world and with a very dark atmosphere, Ecole Privee is the gucci spot to hang with the trend setters. Get there early.

establishement_address: 1184 Place Phillips, Montréal, QC H3B 3C8, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: we were immediately taken with some of the ambitious-sounding ingredient combinations. Yes, you’ll find pork and shrimp dumplings on Jatoba’s menu, but — hey — how about those roasted eggplant and corn dumplings with eel sauce? Though crispy tofu is ubiquitous, who is pairing it with smashed avocado and cucumber? And as for the classic fried rice, how about a version with duck confit?
influencer2_quote_text: Jatoba is in its second year of business and is spearheaded by Chef Olivier, who brought his talents to Montreal’s business district from Quebec City, where he fell in love with Asian cuisine. Jatoba serves a fusion of Asian and South America cuisine.

establishement_address: 141 Avenue du Mont-Royal E, Montréal, QC H1X 2H2, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: This place is a total fun-time gold mine. They throw killer events on Wednesdays with DJs that you do not want to miss.
influencer2_quote_text: Salon Daome is the spot on Mont-Royal Avenue for electro music action, of any genre whatsoever. My personal favorite night is on the Wednesdays for Oasis Wednesdays.

establishement_address: 511 Rue de Courcelle, Montréal, QC H4C 3C1, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: each delicious tortilla is filled to the brim with tasty ingredients, fresh vegetables, and moist, flavourful meats (think chorizo spiced pulled pork, for example). Add this together with their incredibly fair prices, and you’ve got yourself a new favourite burrito spot, my friend.
influencer2_quote_text: The burritos are quite literally bursting at the seams at St-Henri’s tiny Tejano. Watching the guys behind the counter fill orders is kind of compelling, just to witness the sheer amount of stuff they manage to contain in a single tortilla shell.

establishement_address: 245 Rue Sherbrooke Ouest, Montréal, QC H2X 1X7, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: Most brewpubs in Montreal offer a wide variety of beer styles, and most are quite competent. There’s always a blonde ale. Always an IPA. And always a stout or porter. But Benelux had a menu with a point of view — three different saisons, from funky to savory to citrusy.
influencer2_quote_text: While this microbrewery’s Downtown location has been around for longer, their newer off-the-beaten-path spot in Verdun is a way more enjoyable place to sit with a pint. That’s especially the case during the warm months when they set up their gigantic back patio like an outdoor living room.

establishement_address: 151 Rue Ontario E, Montréal, QC H2X 1H5, Canada
establishement_pricerange: $7 for a beer and $10-$13 for a drink
influencer1_quote_text: At Mme Lee, the stars of the menu are the cocktails. They can offer you classics or revisited classics, such as Mme Lee’s Iced Tea. They also have specialty cocktails, such as the Pimms Potager or the Cherry Lemonade with Hennessy.
influencer2_quote_text: Mme Lee is so lowkey most people don’t even know about it. It is the coolest spot around Berri-Uqam and lower St-Laurent. Head there for amazing drinks & dope people.

establishement_address: 4483 Boul St-Laurent, Montréal, QC H2W 1Z8, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: the mixed crowd appreciates the specially-designed spaces perfectly suited for both dancing and drinking
influencer2_quote_text: This is kind of a cross between a music venue and a regular bar. Just past the entrance is a decent sized room with a bar, pool table and tv's, while down the hallway is the huge venue room with the stage, dance floor, another bar, and both an upper and lower sitting area

establishement_address: 950 Rue Ottawa, Montréal, QC H3C 1S4, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: As arguably the most prominent night-club in the cool, dance-savvy Montreal, New City Gas stands proud in Canada's dance pantheon.
influencer2_quote_text: With their main room catering to big acts within the EDM world, New City Gas introduces DSTRKT, a new night taking place in the back terrace that will feature great underground artists on a weekly basis

establishement_address: 3523 Boul St-Laurent, Montréal, QC H2X 2T6, Canada
establishement_hours: vendredi  09:00–19:00 samedi 12:00–17:00 dimanche  Fermé lundi 09:00–17:00 mardi  09:00–19:00 mercredi 09:00–19:00 jeudi 09:00–19:00
influencer1_quote_text: Station 16 is the latest destination for lovers of pop art, graffiti, and street art.
influencer2_quote_text: A modern art gallery that truly invites everyone to take a look at its exhibitions, Station 16 regularly features new artists from around the world, and wants you to see their stuff even if you don't plan on buying anything.

establishement_address: Various
influencer1_quote_text: Montreal-based m0851 has been crafting quality leather goods for more than 25 years.
influencer2_quote_text: A balance between charm and functionality have always been at the heart of M0851. With a total of 22 stores located all around the world, its products are entirely conceived and crafted in Montreal

establishement_address: 4019 Rue Notre-Dame O, Montréal, QC H4C 1R3, Canada
influencer1_quote_text: La Gaillarde is a non-profit eco-fashion boutique located in the neighbourhood of Saint-Henri in Montreal. Officially opened in 2000, they carry a large range of recycled and organic designs, vintage clothing and accessories for both men and women.
influencer2_quote_text: A chic section of second-hand clothing is also offered for both men and women, and every piece goes through a selection process to ensure La Gaillarde’s high quality standards.

establishement_address: Vieux-Port de Montréal, Entrée McGill Coin De la Commune et McGill
establishement_gmap_url: Vieux-Port de Montréal, Entrée McGill Coin De la Commune et McGill
influencer1_quote_text: The 678 portholes and numerous wall-size glass panels afford superb views of the city skyline, though the best vantage point is the external heated whirlpool bath. There might be no warmer spot amid wintry Montreal.
influencer2_quote_text: Bota Bota is a dinky ferry moored in the Old Port, tastefully converted into a spa. Unwind in a sun-deck whirlpool.
